column4: I've got problems with my WLAN. According to the webinterface of the router and the output of iwconfig the connection is established. But I can't send any packets to any computer in my LAN. Any ideas what's going wrong? (details at http://pastebin.com/m6db60d3b)
-> route table okay?
I think so (route -n is shown at http://pastebin.com/m6db60d3b)
-> you cant ping yourself?
no, I can ping myself
-> can you ping localhost?
yes
-> id shutdown, and reseat your pci card or wireless card
that's not an option - it's a notebook
-> you seemed to have either bad nic card, as you can not ping your self
-> how did you set these ip addresses?
but I can ping myself...
I used NetworkManager
-> answer my question, how did you set these?
I used NetworkManager - shall I give iwconfig a try?
-> answer my question, how did you set these?
-> how did your nic get its ip address?  post your /etc/network/interfaces file
there's an icon next to the clock...NetworkManager...with a list of networks -> clicked -> typed WPA-PW
-> forget about using encrypted .. can you try without the encryption first?
yes - moment please
-> you have to disable both in your client(host) and the AP  okay?
